intro: Timonius neocaledonicus, commonly known as the New Caledonian timonius, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentamerous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forested areas with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
